headline: These 2 Airlines Will Gain the Most From Spirit’s Bankruptcy
summary: As anyone who has been nickel-and-dimed on a discount airline knows, you get what you pay for.  Late last week ultra low-cost carrier Spirit Airlines filed for bankruptcy for the second time, sending down shares of parent company  Spirit Aviation Holdings  The move wasn’t a surprise—the airline had previously warned it would have to put hundreds of pilots on leave and said it couldn’t continue operations much longer without a cash infusion.  The hope is that with Spirit sidelined, it will put less pressure on peers that focus more on leisure travelers than road warriors.
